Description.val:
Calibration Equipment Description:
The objective of the Metrology/Calibration (METCAL) Program is to maintain required accuracy and consistency in Navy measurements.  This ensures the required measurement accuracy of Test and Measurement Systems (TAMS) and Aviation Support Equipment (SE) used to test, repair and maintain Aviation Weapon Systems is adequate.  Calibration is an on-cycle maintenance action and can be described as the comparison of a measurement device/system of unverified/unknown accuracy (TAMS or SE) to a device of known and greater accuracy (Calibration Standard).

Fleet Readiness Centers (FRC) Support Equipment (SE)/Industrial Equipment Description:
The Objective of the FRC SE/Industrial Equipment Investment program is to increase Ready Basic Aircraft (RBA). The purchase of equipment for the Fleet Readiness Centers will increase the agility, capability, and capacity to perform the critical mission of repair, overhaul of aircraft, engines, and components while maintaining the organic industrial capacity to meet current and future requirements.

Justification.val:
Calibration Equipment: 
Funds are used to procure Calibration Standards (CALSTDs) and ancillary equipment for Aviation Fleet Intermediate Calibration Activities, Fleet Training Activities, Aviation Navy Calibration Laboratories (NCLs), and the Navy Primary Standards Laboratory (NPSL).  CALSTDs procured for Fleet 'I' level use are to replace obsolete and/or irreparable equipment, expand technical measurement capabilities to decrease Depot support costs, reduce out-of-service turn around times, provide enhanced forward deployed geographic support and reduce/control the Naval Air Systems Command (NAVAIR) cost of ownership associated with Calibration.   Fleet 'I' level calibration activities support 70% of the total Fleet calibration workload.  Maintenance of Fleet calibration capability through this funding results in the release of more expensive Depot level support man-hours for more complex calibration maintenance and calibrations where economy of scale costs dictate single site or geographic calibration center capability.   CALSTDs procured for NCLs and the NPSL allow for the automation and improvement of calibration procedures in order to reduce Fleet asset out-of-service and Turn around Time, expand technical calibration capabilities for enhanced in-theater Fleet support, and replace obsolete and high support cost CALSTDs.

FRC SE/Industrial Equipment:
Funds are used to procure industrial equipment, peculiar and common ground support equipment, necessary to support aircraft, engine, and component depot level repairs.  Replacing obsolete and or irreparable equipment, tooling; test equipment.  Procuring equipment for modernization, maintenance of equipment along with miscellaneous other production charges in support of production and testing services, at depot facilities.  Procuring new types of equipment to modernize and expand technical capabilities to increase throughput. Procuring training aids and fund installation of the equipment to include required environmental enclosures and training equipment; simulators, all in support of aircraft industrial production facilities.

Name.@footnote: Each Cost Element with a Quantity represents a number of different end items.  The Unit Cost is an average cost for all the end items in the Cost element.

Increase of 3 units from FY20-21 is a result of an across the board Aviation Readiness Recovery initiative to fill fleet operational force Calibration Standards inventory shortages per Type Commander priorities in direct support of CV/ L-class ships and associated squadrons.

Increase of 7 units from FY20-21 is a result of an across the board Aviation Readiness Recovery initiative to fill fleet operational force Calibration Standards inventory shortages per Type Commander priorities in direct support of CV/ L-class ships and associated squadrons.

Increase of 4 units from FY20-21 is a result of an across the board Aviation Readiness Recovery initiative to fill fleet operational force Calibration Standards inventory shortages per Type Commander priorities in direct support of CV/ L-class ships and associated squadrons.

Increase from FY20-21 is a result of an across the board Aviation Readiness Recovery initiative to provide the additional contract, acquisition, and engineering resources required to procure and field the increased hardware requirements.

Increase from FY20-21 is a result of an across the board Aviation Readiness Recovery initiative to provide the additional contract, acquisition, and engineering resources required to procure and field the increased hardware requirements.

Each Cost Element with a Quantity represents a number of different end items.  The Unit Cost is an estimated average cost for all the end items in the Cost element. FY21 thru FY25 quantities increase due to the standup of the Infrastructure Optimization Plan (IOP) to support aircraft and components depot repairs.

The totals for Cost Element 1.3 (Equipment Installation) are based on historical values pulled from previous years of Capital Investment Program (CIP) procurement of similar types of  equipment.  Installation cost for equipment projects include minor facilities and utilities modifications and Naval Facilities Engineering Command support costs. FY21 thru FY25 cost increases are due to the Infrastructure Optimization Plan (IOP) to support aircraft and components depot repairs.

The totals for Cost Element 1.4 (Acquisition Support) are based on historical values pulled from previous years of Capital Investment Program (CIP) procurement of similar types of  equipment. The acquisition support costs are based on estimated average fees for the Contracting Administration entities, such as Defense Logistics Agency, for their efforts with contract award and procurement administrative functions.  FY21 thru FY25 cost increases are due to the Infrastructure Optimization Plan (IOP) to support aircraft and components depot repairs.
